Paragraph: However , clinical suspicion should always be supported by histological evidence in order to investigate potential alternate diagnoses such as acute or chronic rejection , interstitial fibrosis and tubular atrophy , or recurrent or de novo glomerulopathy .

The "Disease" entities in the paragraph are "acute rejection", "chronic rejection", "interstitial fibrosis and tubular atrophy", and "recurrent or de novo glomerulopathy". These entities are mentioned as potential alternate diagnoses in the context of a clinical investigation.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

After reviewing the paragraph again, I still find that the four entities identified in my previous response are the only ones that refer to diseases. "Acute rejection" and "chronic rejection" are specific conditions that can occur after organ transplantation. "Interstitial fibrosis and tubular atrophy" is a pattern of injury that can occur in various kidney diseases. "Recurrent or de novo glomerulopathy" refers to a new or recurring kidney disease affecting the glomeruli, the filtering units of the kidney. Therefore, I did not remove any entities from my previous response.
